result.execSummary:
The defendant David W Lawrenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 18 days time served.  Court orders Huber privileges for work, job search, medical treatment and any counseling.  This sentence to run concurrent with 15CM1898 and 15CM2520.
Probation is concurrent with probation in 15CM1898 and 15CM2520.

miscConds.notes:
- provide a DNA sample
Court holds open restitution.  Court does not impose a fine.
Court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges on 15CM1898, 15CM2560 and 15CM2520 at $50/month commencing 3/1/2016 and on the 1st of each month until paid in full.  Any missed payment and the total becomes due and owing immediately to convert to a civil judgment with tax intercept.
- obtain a GED.  Defendant to be enrolled in a GED program by 2-16-2016
- no contact with victim, the retail store named in the complaint
- establish paternity of his child residing in Colorado

- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- no use of alcohol or drugs
- random urine screens

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David W Lawrenz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David W Lawrenz in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to Counts 2 thru 6:  Pursuant to plea negotiations the counts are dismissed and read in.
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 18 days time served.  Court orders Huber privileges for work, job search, medical treatment and any counseling.  This sentence to run concurrent with 15CM1898 and 15CM2520.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.  Probation is concurrent with probation in 15CM1898 and 15CM2520.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety
- no use of alcohol or drugs
- random urine screens
- no contact with victim, the retail store named in the complaint
- establish paternity of his child residing in Colorado
- obtain a GED.  Defendant to be enrolled in a GED program by 2-16-2016
- provide a DNA sample
Court holds open restitution.  Court does not impose a fine.
Court orders defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges on 15CM1898, 15CM2560 and 15CM2520 at $50/month commencing 3/1/2016 and on the 1st of each month until paid in full.  Any missed payment and the total becomes due and owing immediately to convert to a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Justice Point Program report dated February 1, 2016; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed - missed drug test/positive drug test.

Defendant David W Lawrenz in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sears at Southridge Mall 5300 S. 76th Street, Greendale, WI

Defendant David W Lawrenz in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant David W Lawrenz in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 21.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant David W Lawrenz not in court.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 9/4/15 @ 1:30 pm
